description: A hpnicfDot3OamThresholdEvent notification is sent when a local or
remote threshold crossing event is detected. A local
threshold crossing event is detected by the local entity
while a remote threshold crossing event is detected by the
reception of an Ethernet OAM Event Notification OAMPDU
indicating a threshold event.
This notification should not be sent more than once per
second.
The management entity should periodically check
hpnicfDot3OamEventLogTable to detect any missed events.

Summary.eval: ($v3 == 1) ? 'OAM $v4 errored symbol threshold exceeded' : (($v3 == 2) ? 'OAM $v4 errored frame period threshold exceeded' : (($v3 == 3) ? 'OAM $v4 errored frame threshold exceeded' : (($v3 == 4) ? 'OAM $v4 errored frame seconds threshold exceeded' : 'OAM $v4 errored unknown threshold exceeded')))

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamThresholdEvent IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogTimestamp s EXAMPLEE HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogOui s EXA HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogType u 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogLocation i 1 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowHi u 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowLo u 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdHi u 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdLo u 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogValue C 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogRunningTotal C 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogEventTotal u 9999

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The date and time that this event instance occurred.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogTimestamp

description: The OUI of the entity defining the object type. All IEEE
802.3 defined events (as appearing in [802.3ah] except for the
Organizationally Unique Event TLVs) use the IEEE 802.3 OUI of
0x0180C2. Organizations defining their own Event Notification
TLVs include their OUI in the Event Notification TLV which
gets reflected here.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogOui

description: The type of event that generated this entry in the event log.
When the OUI is the IEEE 802.3 OUI of 0x0180C2, the following
event types are defined:
erroredSymbolEvent(1)
erroredFramePeriodEvent (2)
erroredFrameEvent(3)
erroredFrameSecondsEvent(4)
linkFault(256)
dyingGaspEvent(257)
criticalLinkEvent(258)
The first four are considered threshold crossing events as
they are generated when a metric exceeds a given value within
a specified window. The other three are not threshold
crossing events.
When the OUI is not 0x0180C2, then some other organization has
defined the event space. If event subtyping is known to the
implementation, it may be reflected here. Otherwise, this
value should return all Fs (0xFFFFFFFF).
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogType

description: Whether this event occurred locally, or was received from the
OAM peer via Ethernet OAM.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogLocation

description: If the event represents a threshold crossing event, the two
objects hpnicfDot3OamEventWindowHi and hpnicfDot3OamEventWindowLo form an
unsigned 64-bit integer yielding the window over which the
value was measured for the threshold crossing event (e.g. 5
when 11 occurrences happened in 5 seconds while the threshold
was 10). The two objects are combined as:
hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindow = ((2^32) * hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowHi)
+ hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowLo
Otherwise, this value is returned as all F's (0xFFFFFFFF) and
adds no useful information.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowHi

description: If the event represents a threshold crossing event, the two
objects hpnicfDot3OamEventWindowHi and hpnicfDot3OamEventWindowLo form an
unsigned 64-bit integer yielding the window over which the
value was measured for the threshold crossing event (e.g. 5
when 11 occurrences happened in 5 seconds while the threshold
was 10). The two objects are combined as:
hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindow = ((2^32) * hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowHi)
+ hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowLo
Otherwise, this value is returned as all F's (0xFFFFFFFF) and
adds no useful information.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogWindowLo

description: If the event represents a threshold crossing event, the two
objects hpnicfDot3OamEventThresholdHi and hpnicfDot3OamEventThresholdLo
form an unsigned 64-bit integer yielding the value that was
crossed for the threshold crossing event (e.g. 10, when 11
occurrences happened in 5 seconds while the threshold was 10).
The two objects are combined as:
hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThreshold = ((2^32) * hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdHi)
+ hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdLo
Otherwise, this value is returned as all F's (0xFFFFFFFF) and
adds no useful information.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdHi

description: If the event represents a threshold crossing event, the two
objects hpnicfDot3OamEventThresholdHi and hpnicfDot3OamEventThresholdLo
form an unsigned 64-bit integer yielding the value that was
crossed for the threshold crossing event (e.g. 10, when 11
occurrences happened in 5 seconds while the threshold was 10).
The two objects are combined as:
hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThreshold = ((2^32) * hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdHi)
+ hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdLo
Otherwise, this value is returned as all F's (0xFFFFFFFF) and
adds no useful information.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogThresholdLo

description: If the event represents a threshold crossing event, this
value indicates the value of the parameter within the given
window that generated this event (e.g. 11, when 11 occurrences
happened in 5 seconds while the threshold was 10).
Otherwise, this value is returned as all F's
(0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF) and adds no useful information.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogValue

description: This value respresents the total number of times this
occurence has happened since the last reset (e.g. 3253, when
3253 symbol errors have occurred since the last reset, which
has resulted in 51 symbol error threshold crossing events
since the last reset).
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogRunningTotal

description: This value respresents the total number of times one or more
of these occurences have resulted in an event (e.g. 51 when
3253 symbol errors have occurred since the last reset, which
has resulted in 51 symbol error threshold crossing events
since the last reset).
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogEventTotal

description: A hpnicfDot3OamNonThresholdEvent notification is sent when a local
or remote non-threshold crossing event is detected. A local
event is detected by the local entity, while a remote event is
detected by the reception of an Ethernet OAM Event
Notification OAMPDU indicating a non-threshold crossing event.
This notification should not be sent more than once per
second.
The management entity should periodically check
hpnicfDot3OamEventLogTable to detect any missed events.

Summary.eval: ($v3 == 256) ? 'OAM $v4 link fault event detected' : (($v3 == 257) ? 'OAM $v4 dying gasp event detected' : (($v3 == 258) ? 'OAM $v4 critical link event detected' : 'OAM $v4 unknown event detected'))

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamNonThresholdEvent IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogTimestamp s EXAMPLEE HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogOui s EXA HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogType u 9999 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogLocation i 1 HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogEventTotal u 9999

When the OUI is the IEEE 802.3 OUI of 0x0180C2, the following

erroredSymbolEvent(1)

linkFault(256)

The first four are considered threshold crossing events as
they are generated when a metric exceeds a given value within
a specified window. The other three are not threshold
crossing events.
When the OUI is not 0x0180C2, then some other organization has
defined the event space. If event subtyping is known to the

variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogType

OAM peer via Ethernet OAM.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogLocation

description: This value respresents the total number of times one or more
of these occurences have resulted in an event (e.g. 51 when
3253 symbol errors have occurred since the last reset, which

variables.name: HPN-ICF-EFM-COMMON-MIB::hpnicfDot3OamEventLogEventTotal
